Search Physician Fee Schedule

Source: R/fee_schedule.R
search_fee_schedule.Rd

Search Physician Fee Schedule

Usage

search_fee_schedule(hcpcs, state = NULL, locality = NULL, mac = NULL, ...)

Arguments

hcpcs

< chr > 5-character HCPCS Code

state

< chr > 2-character State Abbreviation

locality

< chr > 2-digit Locality ID

mac

< chr > 5-digit MAC ID code

...

Empty

Value

A tibble with the columns:

ColumnDescription
hcpcs5-character HCPCS Code
hcpcs_typeHCPCS Type
descriptionHCPCS Description
cons_descHCPCS Level I Consumer Description
clin_descsHCPCS Level I Clinician Descriptions
modModifier
statusStatus Code
macMedicare Administrative Contractor ID
stateState Abbreviation
localityState Abbreviation
areaState Abbreviation
countiesState Abbreviation
two_macsState Abbreviation
wgpciState Abbreviation
pgpciState Abbreviation

Examples

search_fee_schedule(hcpcs    = c("V5299", "70170"),
                    state    = "GA",
                    locality = "99",
                    mac      = "10212")
#> # A tibble: 4 × 71
#>   hcpcs description description_long description_consumer descriptions_clinician
#>   <chr> <chr>       <chr>            <chr>                <list>                
#> 1 V5299 Hearing se… Hearing service… NA                   <NULL>                
#> 2 70170 X-ray exam… NA               Review by radiologi… <tibble [1 × 1]>      
#> 3 70170 X-ray exam… NA               Review by radiologi… <tibble [1 × 1]>      
#> 4 70170 X-ray exam… NA               Review by radiologi… <tibble [1 × 1]>      
#> # ℹ 66 more variables: rbcs_category <chr>, rbcs_family <chr>, status <chr>,
#> #   mac <chr>, state <chr>, locality <chr>, area <chr>, counties <chr>,
#> #   wgpci <dbl>, pgpci <dbl>, mgpci <dbl>, wrvu <dbl>, fprvu <dbl>, mrvu <dbl>,
#> #   cf <dbl>, f_fee <dbl>, nf_fee <dbl>, frvus <dbl>, nrvus <dbl>, fpar <dbl>,
#> #   npar <dbl>, fnpar <dbl>, nfnpar <dbl>, flim <dbl>, nlim <dbl>, opps <chr>,
#> #   opps_nf <dbl>, opps_f <dbl>, fprvu_opps <dbl>, mrvu_opps <dbl>,
#> #   fpymt_opps <dbl>, nfpymt_opps <dbl>, mult_surg <chr>, mult_proc <chr>, …
